title: Love Islanders claim they're 'super serious' after Eamonn's 'offensive' remark
text:
Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

The Love Island stars competing on the celebrity X Factor have claimed they were "super serious" after Eamonn Holmes' jibes.

Samira Mighty , Wes Nelson , Zara McDermott and Eyal Booker have formed a singing supergroup and are hoping to walk away with a record contract.

But Eamonn described them as a "novelty act" and admitted he was prepared to laugh at them when they first performed.

The This Morning presenter said he wasn't trying to be offensive when he revealed his son thought they were "surprisingly good" - and claimed their band name was like a group "hanging out at a cinema".

Eamonn said: "Guys I don’t mean to be offensive with 'surprisingly good'. But you think, in a way, a bit of a novelty thing going on?"

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

(Image: ITV)

In agreement, Wes said: "I think that was what we are going for. We didn’t expect it the first time we were working together.

"When we came out on stage and got such an amazing response - everyone was pleasantly surprised."

However, Eyal claimed they were "super serious" about competing and have their eyes on the prize.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

The spiritual Islander said: "We are super serious about this and performing is a passion of all of ours. To get an opportunity to do that is were just so grateful and thankful for.

"People don’t expect it. Hopefully we can prove them wrong that we’re not just one-dimensional people."

On the audition at Simon’s house in LA, Eyal admitted: "It was the most daunting experience and we were like, if we don’t do well, then we’re not going to do well [in the whole competition]."

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Eyal confessed they were still working on the name of the band and are hoping to stay in the contest so they can grow.

He said: "I think we definitely intend to carry on. I think we started off in a good place but know we have so much more to give.

"We want to make it through to the live shows as we can grow and find our sound and it will be a journey for us."

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Ruth asked Samira what she knew about her fellow Islanders’ singing talents.

She said: “In the villa I would always sing in the shower and Wez would come up and just harmonise together and I would be like, ‘What?’”

To which Wez importantly added: “Not actually in the shower! Just stood outside.”

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: Eamonn described the Love Island supergroup as an X Factor 'novelty act' and admitted he was prepared to laugh at them
